result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrie C Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 17-CM-22.  Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

for DNA Sample

Defendant Jeffrie C Lawson in court with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Jeffrie C Lawson in court with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Mancoske requests another status date, needs some more time to review files with defendant. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrie C Lawson in court with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrie C Lawson appears by video conference along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Jeffrie C Lawson in custody. Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Heyne hasn't been able to locate or contact defendant. Mark Hill of Door Co. Human Services indicates defendant is on the run. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
